definition: spirit of a martyr/spirit of the brave departed/person of remarkable talent
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: The Yngling will make its Olympic debut in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 英灵级作为奥运会项目将在2004年首次登场。

sentences.english: His spirit would no longer remain with him.
sentences.chinese: 他的英灵将不在与卢克同在。

sentences.english: On the Pure Brightness, we held a memorial service for martyrs in the funerary park.
sentences.chinese: 清明节那天我们在墓园里墓祭了烈士们的英灵。

sentences.english: Collection of HeYue Yingling was a set of characteristic selected poems in the properous Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《河岳英灵集》为盛唐颇具特色的诗选集。

sentences.english: But life has taught me that the hero is already in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 但是生活告诉我，我们的英灵早已经在天堂。

sentences.english: These shores will still swarm with the dead of my people.
sentences.chinese: 这一带海岸仍将到处有我们祖先的英灵出没。

sentences.english: His Malazan Book of the Fallen series is one the best works of writing I’ve ever come across.
sentences.chinese: 他的《玛拉兹英灵录》系列是我读过的最好的书作。

definition: god/spirit/demon/occult or supernatural entities in general
